14. b5 Qa3

14. c3 Qa4 =

Material is equal and white does not have enough after 15. b3 Qa3 16. Bc1 Qxc1 = or 15. Qxa4 fxe4 =.

13 ... Qa3

  • 14. Qd2
  • 14. c3
14. Qd2

14. Qd2 fxe4

Black wants Qf3 and white can block in one of three ways.

15. Qd3/Qe3 Qc3 16. Qxc3 Rxa2 =

If white blocks on d3 or e3, black can force a trade with 16 ... Qc3 and then take on a2.

15. Qc3 =

If black blocks on c3, black can force Qxa3-Rxa2 with 15 ... d5 and then 16 ... e5 (since d4 and d3 are eventually threatened if white plays dxe5)
14. c3

14. c3 Qb2 15. Qc2 fxe4 =

White's only move for a draw here is 16. Ke2 since black threatens Qb1-Qxb1.

16. Ke2 =

16 ... c5 17. h5 b5 18. Rh1 =

Luckily here black has 18 ... Qxc3 19. a3 Bb7 =.
9. Nb6 axb6
  • 10. h4
  • 10. d5

10. d5

10 ... Ra4

11. Bb6 Qxb6

12. Bb5

12 ... Rd4 13. Bd3

13 ... Bd2 14. Kf1

14 ... fxg4

15. Qh5 g6 16. Qg5

16 ... O-O 17. f3

17 ... Bxg5

16 ... Ng4 17. f3 Nf6

18. dxe6 Bxg5

A similar position could be reached if black repositions the knight to f6 and white captures on e6, forcing 18 ... Bxg5.

19. Rg1 d6 20. h3 O-O 21. c4 h5 22. a4
